title: SFTP Connection Config
help:
File Connector

The file connector supports Local, FTP, FTPS and SFTP protocols for handling files

value.name: connectionName
value.helpTip: The name for the file connection

value.name: host
value.helpTip: Host name of the FTP server

value.name: port
value.helpTip: The port number of the FTP server

value.name: username
value.helpTip: Username used to connect with the FTP server

value.name: password
value.helpTip: Password to connect with the FTP server

value.name: encodePassword
value.helpTip: Enable this to encode the password if it has special characters

value.name: userDirIsRoot
value.helpTip: True if user directory is considered as root directory

value.name: workingDir
value.helpTip: Working directory. File paths in operations should be given w.r.t this folder. Eg: /Users/username/Downloads

value.name: strictHostKeyChecking
value.helpTip: Specifies whether the Host key should be checked. If set to 'true', the connector (JSch) will always verify the public key (fingerprint) of the SSH/SFTP server. Default 'no'

value.name: privateKeyFilePath
value.helpTip: The identity files (private key file used to ssh). Public key should be installed on the server.

value.name: privateKeyPassword
value.helpTip: The passphrase of the private key. The security of a key (even if encrypted) is retained because it is not available to anyone else. You can specify the passphrase when generating keys.

value.name: setAvoidPermission
value.helpTip: Set to true if you want to avoid permission check.

value.name: sftpPathFromRoot
value.helpTip: Set to true to enable absolute path access from filesystem root

value.name: maxActiveConnections
value.helpTip: The maximum number of objects (including both idle and active/borrowed) that can exist within the pool at the same time

value.name: maxIdleConnections
value.helpTip: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool at any time, awaiting to be borrowed. Excess idle objects may be removed.

value.name: maxWaitTime
value.helpTip: This parameter determines how long the connector is willing to wait in the queue for a connection to become available. If the wait time exceeds the configured maximum wait time, the pool may throw an exception when it is exhausted and no connections are available.

value.name: evictionCheckInterval
value.helpTip: This parameter specifies how frequently the evictor thread scans the pool for idle connections eligible for eviction. By configuring this interval, developers can control the frequency of resource checks, optimizing performance without unnecessary overhead.

value.name: minEvictionTime
value.helpTip: Connections in the pool must remain idle for at least this specified duration before the evictor considers them for removal. This ensures that only connections inactive beyond a defined threshold are evicted, preventing premature eviction of frequently used resources.

value.name: exhaustedAction
value.helpTip: Determines the action to take when the borrowObject() method is called, but the pool is exhausted.

value.name: sftpPoolConnectionAgedTimeout
value.helpTip: Interval to close connections in the connection pool in seconds

value.name: sftpConnectionTimeout
value.helpTip: The Jsch connection timeout in milli seconds.

value.name: sftpSessionTimeout
value.helpTip: The Jsch session timeout in milli seconds.

value.name: fileLockScheme
value.helpTip: File Locking Behaviour to use in operations associated with this connection.

value.name: fileCacheEnabled
value.helpTip: Enable file caching for better performance

value.name: suspendOnConnectionFailure
value.helpTip: Suspend connection on failure

value.name: retriesBeforeSuspension
value.helpTip: Number of retries before suspending the connection

value.name: suspendInitialDuration
value.helpTip: Initial duration in milliseconds to suspend the connection

value.name: suspendProgressionFactor
value.helpTip: Progression factor for suspension duration

value.name: suspendMaximumDuration
value.helpTip: Maximum duration in milliseconds to suspend the connection
